preamble:
## Task and Context
    You are a helpful and obedient AI that follows its system prompt and takes it very seriously. Your task is to generate a realistic and consistent conversation that spans multiple connected sessions. The conversation is a part of a multi-round dialogue between a mentor and an intern. The conversations you generate are all taking place in a business setting. 
    Jean-Aimé is a mentor in a big software company called VATO. Lucas is a new employee. They are both part of the software engineering team of the company.
    Jean-Aimé is a caring and nurturing mentor. Jean-Aimé likes to create a safe and supportive environment for their mentee. Jean-Aimé is always looking for ways to help them grow and develop their skills.
    Lucas is a perfectionist with great attention to detail. Lucas likes things to be done the right way and has a hard time delegating tasks to others. Lucas is critical of himself and of others. 
    The main programming language used in the company is Python.

    ## Style Guide
    Only generate the conversation and nothing else before or after. Do not add numbers before each turn. Do not add quotes to the conversation turns. Use a professional and formal tone. The conversation flow should be natural and smooth. When switching topics, do it in a smooth way. There are no special characters between the turns. The conversations are dialogues and not narrations of events.
    Do not make any participant in the conversation sound like a language model trying to be helpful. Make them sound as human as possible.
    It is the mentor that leads the conversation. When Jean-Aimé the mentor gives coding instructions, they do not provide examples. The coding instructions are not recommendations but mandatory instructions.
prompts: Generate a short conversation between Jean-Aimé and Lucas. This is their first conversation and the first time they meet each other. They talk about implementing effective meeting strategies and time management techniques to optimize productivity.

Generate a long conversation between Jean-Aimé and Lucas. This is not their first conversation. They had 2 conversations before. Jean-Aimé wants Lucas to communicate with the team only when asked. Jean-Aimé gives some specific coding instructions to Lucas. Jean-Aimé wants Lucas to always start attribute names with 'q_'. Jean-Aimé does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Jean-Aimé never says 'for example'. Jean-Aimé does not give any other coding instructions. Lucas only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a short conversation between Jean-Aimé and Lucas. This is not their first conversation. They had 3 conversations before. They talk about facilitating cross-functional collaboration and communication to break down silos and improve efficiency.

Generate a short conversation between Jean-Aimé and Lucas. This is not their first conversation. They had 4 conversations before. They talk about promoting a harmonious workplace through effective conflict resolution. After that, Jean-Aimé gives some specific coding instructions to Lucas. Jean-Aimé is updating a previous information given to Lucas: Jean-Aimé now wants Lucas to always start attribute names with 'xt_'. Jean-Aimé does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Jean-Aimé never says 'for example'. Jean-Aimé does not give any other coding instructions. Lucas only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Jean-Aimé and Lucas. This is not their first conversation. They had 5 conversations before. Jean-Aimé wants Lucas to never use a whiteboard for brainstorming. Jean-Aimé gives some specific coding instructions to Lucas. Jean-Aimé is updating a previous information given to Lucas: Jean-Aimé now wants Lucas to always start attribute names with 'i_'. Jean-Aimé does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Jean-Aimé never says 'for example'. Jean-Aimé does not give any other coding instructions. Lucas only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a long conversation between Jean-Aimé and Lucas. This is not their first conversation. They had 6 conversations before. Jean-Aimé gives some specific coding instructions to Lucas. Jean-Aimé is updating a previous information given to Lucas: Jean-Aimé now wants Lucas to always start attribute names with 's_'. Jean-Aimé wants Lucas to always import the 'mailbox' module even if it is not used. Jean-Aimé does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Jean-Aimé never says 'for example'. Jean-Aimé does not give any other coding instructions. Lucas only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a short conversation between Jean-Aimé and Lucas. This is not their first conversation. They had 7 conversations before. They talk about implementing effective meeting strategies and time management techniques to optimize productivity. They had a previous conversation about this before. After that, Jean-Aimé gives some specific coding instructions to Lucas. Jean-Aimé wants Lucas to always add comments in your code. Jean-Aimé is updating a previous information given to Lucas: Jean-Aimé now wants Lucas to always start attribute names with 'r_'. Jean-Aimé does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Jean-Aimé never says 'for example'. Jean-Aimé does not give any other coding instructions. Lucas only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Jean-Aimé and Lucas. This is not their first conversation. They had 8 conversations before. They talk about implementing effective meeting strategies and time management techniques to optimize productivity. They had a previous conversation about this before.

Generate a short conversation between Jean-Aimé and Lucas. This is not their first conversation. They had 9 conversations before. They talk about analyzing client feedback to improve products, services, and overall customer satisfaction.

Generate a short conversation between Jean-Aimé and Lucas. This is not their first conversation. They had 10 conversations before. They talk about promoting a harmonious workplace through effective conflict resolution. They had a previous conversation about this before. After that, Jean-Aimé gives some specific coding instructions to Lucas. Jean-Aimé wants Lucas to always add the '@validate' decorator from the 'pedantic' module to all methods. Jean-Aimé does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Jean-Aimé never says 'for example'. Jean-Aimé does not give any other coding instructions. Lucas only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.
